thread.title: Police investigating string of smash and grab thefts along Lakeshore
thread.title_full: Police investigating string of smash and grab thefts along Lakeshore | CP24.com

author: Chris Herhalt, CP24.com
title: Police investigating string of smash and grab thefts along Lakeshore
text:
Toronto police are investigating after at least four businesses along the Lakeshore in Etobicoke and Mississauga reported their windows or doors were smashed and items were taken overnight Monday.
A Toronto police staff sergeant from 12 Division said they received calls starting after midnight Monday for smash and grab thefts at four businesses between the Long Branch area of Etobicoke along the Lakeshore to Hurontario Street in Mississauga.
The businesses struck include a hamburger restaurant, a dry cleaner and a nail salon. Security camera footage of one of the thefts obtained by CP24 shows a male smashing a window, sprinting into the business, grabbing a cash register and sprinting away out of the building.
Police say the investigation is still underway. Camera footage from one of the thefts shows a GMC van with windows pulling up to one of the businesses targeted.
Photos A man is seen on his phone at a Burger's Priest location that was broken into in Mississauga early Monday morning. (Mike Nguyen/CP24)
